articles.title: How accurate are UK coronavirus death toll numbers? - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Britain suffers deadliest week since records began as 16,387 deaths recorded in England and Wales in seven days to April 3
articles.content: Tom Dening, a professor of dementia research at the University of Nottingham, said: "It is worrying that there appears to be a sharp increase in deaths in the community that are not known to be due to Covid-19. So far, we don't have good data on the possible … [+19993 chars]

articles.title: Why are so many black and ethnic minority people dying from coronavirus? - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Despite only accounting for 13pc of the population in England and Wales, 44pc of NHS doctors and 24pc of nurses are from a BAME background
articles.content: Mr Chowdhury, who worked as a consultant urologist at Homerton Hospital in east London, said in his post: People appreciate us and salute us for our rewarding job which are very inspirational but I would like to say we have to protect ourselves and our famili… [+1508 chars]

articles.description: Are surgical masks better than cycling masks – and how about a simple scarf wrapped around your neck? We explain everything you need to know
articles.content:
Take a deep breath and prepare yourself for the latest Covid-19 essential soon to sweep the nation. After months of being instructed not to trouble ourselves with wearing masks during the coronavirus outbreak, it has become a hot topic once again.
